Posted By: tcollins (1/18/2011 5:48:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This was a long time ago, but it is still a solid card.   
I used it with [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar), [Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger), and [Twilight Shepherd](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twilight Shepherd) to make 6/6 tramplers for each ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) that I spent. Well I did until [Mitotic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mitotic Slime) came out (two 2/2's for each ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)). Nowadays anti-wrath creatures are in every set, but they were pretty rare in 2001 when this punked [Rootbreaker Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rootbreaker Wurm).  
I won a lot of games with Penumbra Wurm and this gives me warm fuzzy feelings when I remember it.
posts.html:
This was a long time ago, but it is still a solid card.
I used it with Ashnod's Altar, Juniper Order Ranger, and Twilight Shepherd to make 6/6 tramplers for each that I spent. Well I did until Mitotic Slime came out (two 2/2's for each ). Nowadays anti-wrath creatures are in every set, but they were pretty rare in 2001 when this punked Rootbreaker Wurm.
I won a lot of games with Penumbra Wurm and this gives me warm fuzzy feelings when I remember it.
